intro: Stemonurus mappiodes, commonly known as the Mappian starwort, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
